main-hero-sub1: I'm an IT student building interactive web apps and experimenting with UI/UX design as well as backend setups.
main-hero-sub2: I specialize in front- and back-end development, I enjoy turning ideas into engaging digital experiences I also enjoy making games!
main-project-description-realm:
REALM is a TTRPG (tabletop role-playing game) inspired by Dungeons & Dragons. The project is under active development and is structured as logically separated services within a monorepo using TypeScript, Node.js, and Phaser.js.

I designed and implemented the networking layer from scratch using WebSockets. The game is structured around classic fantasy races and classes, with an emphasis on teamwork and cooperative gameplay.
main-project-title-deal-gone-dark: Deal Gone Dark - 2D Stealth PvP Action Game
main-project-description-deal-gone-dark: Deal Gone Dark is a 2D stealth action game where players take on the role of a robber infiltrating a casino. The game features pre-generated levels, full 2-5 player multiplayer support. Developed using TypeScript and Phaser.js with Colyseus as the server, the project focuses on creating an enjoyable experience with semi-dynamic lighting and sound design.
main-project-description-agent-q: AgentQ was based on popular quiz websites like Redmenta and Quizlet. It allows users to create, share, and play quizzes in a competitive multiplayer environment. Built with TypeScript, React, and Node.js, the project emphasizes user engagement through an agent style quiz taker website
main-page-tech-description: Here are some of the technologies and languages I have experience with:
page-tech-subtitle: The Languages, Frameworks & Tools I use daily in large-scale and smaller projects, while some of them are general use others are just experiments (like docker) and I only use them to have experience with it if one day I need to utilize it.
page-tech-javascript-desc: I've used JavaScript extensively for both front-end and back-end development, building interactive web applications and server-side logic. Earlier projects relied heavily on Node.js and Express.js, before I transitioned to TypeScript.
page-tech-typescript-desc: TypeScript has been my primary language for several years. I use it to build robust web applications, develop games with Phaser.js, and create server-side applications with Node.js. It's my go-to language for both simple and complex tasks, as it combines the flexibility of scripting with the safety of strong typing.
page-tech-csharp-desc: C# was the first strongly typed language I learned. I initially used it to build simple console applications, then moved on to object-oriented programming concepts. While I have solid experience with it, it is not my primary choice today due to ecosystem preferences compared to other languages I use.
page-tech-html-desc: HTML is the foundation of web development, and I've used it extensively to structure web pages and applications. My experience includes writing semantic HTML5 that is accessible and SEO-friendly.
page-tech-css-desc: CSS is essential for styling web pages and applications. I've used it to create responsive layouts, animations, and modern UI designs that improve user experience.
page-tech-unity-desc: Unity is a powerful game engine I've used to develop both 2D and 3D games. While these projects were experimental, I gained experience with C# scripting, the Unity Editor, and implementing core gameplay mechanics.
page-tech-unreal-engine-desc: Unreal Engine is a high-end game engine I've worked with to create visually impressive projects. My experience includes using Blueprints for rapid prototyping, with a particular focus on VR development.
page-tech-phaser-desc: Phaser is an HTML5 game framework I've used to develop 2D games. My experience includes core game development concepts, implementing physics mechanics, and handling animations.
page-tech-react-desc: React is a JavaScript library I use to build dynamic and interactive user interfaces. My experience includes creating reusable components, managing state with hooks, and optimizing performance through the virtual DOM.
page-tech-node-js-desc: Node.js is a runtime environment I use for building server-side applications. My experience includes developing REST APIs, handling asynchronous operations, and integrating databases.
page-tech-express-js-desc: Express.js goes hand in hand with Node.js. I've used it as the primary backend framework in my projects to handle routing, middleware, and server-side application logic.
page-tech-vite-desc: Vite is a build tool I use to create fast, modern, and efficient development environments for web applications.
page-tech-mysql-desc: MySQL is a relational database management system I've used to store, query, and manage structured data across multiple projects.
page-tech-mongodb-desc: MongoDB is a NoSQL database I've used for storing and retrieving unstructured data in scalable, backend-driven applications.
page-tech-git-github-desc: Git and GitHub are version control tools I use extensively for managing repositories, collaborating with others, and tracking code changes.
page-tech-vscode-desc: Visual Studio Code is my primary code editor, where I write, debug, and manage all of my projects efficiently.
page-tech-docker-desc: While I wouldn't call myself a Docker expert, I've used it to containerize applications, manage dependencies, and improve development workflows.
